I just found out I could write in my query letter that another agency is considering my manuscript. I thought you could only say if you've had an offer! Ugh. I feel like this would help push my letter to the top, but now I guess I'm just waiting, waiting, doing terribly, waiting.

Oh! I remember the 3rd thing: even when you DO publish, you still have to put yourself out there-push and promote your book! No one’s gonna just “discover” you on the shelf. You have to sell yourself. Do the newsletters. And events. And call your local papers. Promote yourself!

2. No one is going to come knocking on your door, or emailing your inbox, with a publishing offer. You have to put yourself out there. Submit. Query. Repeat. And keep going! 

3. That's it I guess, so two levels, not multiple, lol. Anything to add? Feel free to discuss!

1. You need to fully discover and establish your own voice before you're ready to publish. No one is going to tell you, Ah! This is you! Here is your unique voice. You just have to write and write and write and figure that shit out. /
